industry: Telecommunications, Consumer Services, and Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Job Description:

This position is responsible for the transactional and analytical parts of the logistics claims lifecycle for Client products; including Inbound and Outbound Shipping & Delivery (OS&D) investigation, credit issue to customer, filing claims, and claims recovery from warehouse and transportation 3PL/carriers.

The position ensures claims process is smoothly run through the channel by collecting and reviewing delivery and documentation items, investigating OS&D cases with logistics colleagues and processing claims via phone and personal contact with logistics colleagues, business partners, internal partners, and customers.


Education and Work Experience:

5 years of experience in logistics and/or transportation

Education Bachelors / undergrad.

Top 3 Skill Sets: Claims experience, organized, data analysis


Specific responsibilities include:

  • Investigate, review and validate discrepancy cases to process credit to customer
  • Communicate with credit and collection team to ensure all deductions are disputed or credited correctly
  • Resolve claims and verify disputes/denials, if any, by communicating with 3PL/carrier
  • Ensure claim cases are settled and closed timely in accordance with 3PL contract
  • Prepare and submit claimable cases to the client's insurance and follow thru the settlement; communicate with insurance for cargo claims
  • Monitor performance of 3PL analyzing and prioritizing work loading in claim creation and recovery
  • Preparing daily and weekly reports for management
  • Analyzing claims data to identify trends and patterns and recommending process improvement opportunities to the Logistics operations team
  • All other duties as assigned and adhoc reports


Skills and Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s or undergrad Degree in Logistics, Supply Chain, Business, Finance or similar
  • 5 years of work experience in a business or logistics environment.
  • Preferable: General knowledge of logistics and/or supply chain.
  • Experience / Knowledge in SAP
  • The ability to read, prepare, interpret, and understand product shipment information in English from various order and shipping documents to ensure accuracy and thorough preparation of transportation documents.
  • Works on problems of limited and routine scope where limited analysis of data requires identification of predetermined solutions.
  • Ability to manage and work effectively within cross-functional groups
  • Proven success in a highly dynamic, deadline-driven environment
  • Should have advanced MS Excel and MS PowerPoint knowledge and skills
  • Strong communication, both written (PPT presentations) and oral skills.
  • The ability to work either independently or in a team environment to achieve personal and team project goals, including the completion of assignments within and exceeding established time frames.


Note: The payrate for this position ranges between $35 - $40/hr. on W2, depending on the nature of the job, contract type, location and industry trends.
